elements.title: A virally-encoded tRNA neutralizes the PARIS antiviral defence system (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A virally-encoded tRNA neutralizes the PARIS antiviral defence system

  • Nathaniel Burman
  • Svetlana Belukhina
  • Artem Isaev
Article07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Structure of the human dopamine transporter and mechanisms of inhibition (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Structure of the human dopamine transporter and mechanisms of inhibition

Cryo-electron microscopy structure of the human dopamine transporter in complex with multiple inhibitors illuminates mechanisms of allosteric inhibition.

  • Dushyant Kumar Srivastava
  • Vikas Navratna
  • Eric Gouaux
ArticleOpen Access07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Dopamine reuptake and inhibitory mechanisms in human dopamine transporter (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Dopamine reuptake and inhibitory mechanisms in human dopamine transporter

Structural analyses of the human dopamine transporter in apo and substrate-bound states and in complex with drugs and inhibitors reveal key binding residues and conformational transitions that occur during substrate transport.

  • Yue Li
  • Xianping Wang
  • Yan Zhao
Article07 Aug 2024

elements.title: The ribosome lowers the entropic penalty of protein folding (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The ribosome lowers the entropic penalty of protein folding

Structures of the growing peptide chain on and off the ribosome reveal that the ribosome destabilizes the unfolded nascent chain, promoting the formation of partially folded intermediate states.

  • Julian O. Streit
  • Ivana V. Bukvin
  • John Christodoulou
ArticleOpen Access07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Architecture and activation mechanism of the bacterial PARIS defence system (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Architecture and activation mechanism of the bacterial PARIS defence system

The bacterial phage anti-restriction-induced system, PARIS, operates as a toxinantitoxin system, in which the antitoxin AriA sequesters and inactivates the toxin AriB until triggered by the T7 phage counterdefence protein Ocr.

  • Amar Deep
  • Qishan Liang
  • Kevin D. Corbett
Article07 Aug 2024

elements.title: DNA-sensing inflammasomes cause recurrent atherosclerotic stroke (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
DNA-sensing inflammasomes cause recurrent atherosclerotic stroke

This study describes sensing of circulating cell-free DNA after stroke as the mechanism leading to recurrent ischemic events.

  • Jiayu Cao
  • Stefan Roth
  • Arthur Liesz
ArticleOpen Access07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Glycosphingolipid synthesis mediates immune evasion in KRAS-driven cancer (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Glycosphingolipid synthesis mediates immune evasion in KRAS-driven cancer

Functional genomics and lipidomic analyses reveal that sphingolipid synthesis is required for tumour immune evasion and tumour growth in vivo, mediated in part by the impact of glycosphingolipid synthesis on cell surface expression of IFN receptors.

  • Mariluz Soula
  • Gokhan Unlu
  • Kvan Birsoy
Article07 Aug 2024

elements.title: A nebular origin for the persistent radio emission of fast radio bursts (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A nebular origin for the persistent radio emission of fast radio bursts

Observations of a third, less luminous persistent radio source associated with the repeating fast radio burst FRB20201124A indicate that the burst originates from a young magnetar surrounded by a nebula of ionized gas.

  • Gabriele Bruni
  • Luigi Piro
  • Rosita Paladino
Article07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Membrane prewetting by condensates promotes tight-junction belt formation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Membrane prewetting by condensates promotes tight-junction belt formation

Experimental and theoretical results demonstrate that tight-junction formation depends on the growth of a condensed layer of ZO-1 proteins at the interface of the apical and lateral membrane, providing insight into self-assembly of complex mesoscale structures in cells.

  • Karina Pombo-Garca
  • Omar Adame-Arana
  • Alf Honigmann
ArticleOpen Access07 Aug 2024

elements.title: The genomic landscape of 2,023 colorectal cancers (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The genomic landscape of 2,023 colorectal cancers

Whole-genome sequencing of more than 2,000 colorectal carcinoma samples provides a highly detailed view of the genomic landscape of this cancer and identifies new driver mutations.

  • Alex J. Cornish
  • Andreas J. Gruber
  • Richard S. Houlston
ArticleOpen Access07 Aug 2024

elements.title: PTER is a N-acetyltaurine hydrolase that regulates feeding and obesity (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
PTER is a N-acetyltaurine hydrolase that regulates feeding and obesity

The orphan enzyme phosphotriesterase-related (PTER) is identified as a mammalian N-acetyltaurine hydrolase that has roles in regulating body weight and energy balance.

  • Wei Wei
  • Xuchao Lyu
  • Jonathan Z. Long
ArticleOpen Access07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Coevolution of craton margins and interiors during continental break-up (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Coevolution of craton margins and interiors during continental break-up

By integrating geological observations, statistical analysis, geodynamic simulations and landscape-evolution models, a physical model is proposed to link the coevolution of craton margins and interiors with continental rifting.

  • Thomas M. Gernon
  • Thea K. Hincks
  • Anne Glerum
ArticleOpen Access07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Prognostic genome and transcriptome signatures in colorectal cancers (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Prognostic genome and transcriptome signatures in colorectal cancers

A large integrated genome and transcriptome analysis of colorectal cancer identifies prognostic mutations and expression subtypes.

  • Lus Nunes
  • Fuqiang Li
  • Tobias Sjblom
ArticleOpen Access07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Titration of RAS alters senescent state and influences tumour initiation (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Titration of RAS alters senescent state and influences tumour initiation

Oncogenic RAS dose-escalation models are used to explore how the level of RAS determines whether cells enter a senescent state or have tumour-initiating activity.

  • Adelyne S. L. Chan
  • Haoran Zhu
  • Masashi Narita
ArticleOpen Access07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Structure of the human dopamine transporter in complex with cocaine (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Structure of the human dopamine transporter in complex with cocaine

A study using cryo-electron microscopy has determined the structure of the human dopamine transporter with bound cocaine, revealing molecular details about neurotransmitter transport and how it is affected by neuropsychiatric drugs.

  • Jeppe C. Nielsen
  • Kristine Salomon
  • Claus J. Loland
Article07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Teosinte Pollen Drive guides maize diversification and domestication by RNAi (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Teosinte Pollen Drive guides maize diversification and domestication by RNAi

An example of hybrid incompatibility between maize and teosinte reveals a selfish toxinantidote system mediated by small RNAs that may have contributed to the origin of maize.

  • Benjamin Berube
  • Evan Ernst
  • Robert A. Martienssen
ArticleOpen Access07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Highest ocean heat in four centuries places Great Barrier Reef in danger (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Highest ocean heat in four centuries places Great Barrier Reef in danger

High ocean temperatures that caused mass coral bleaching and mortality on the Great Barrier Reef in the past decade are the warmest in 400 years and are the result of human-caused climate change.

  • Benjamin J. Henley
  • Helen V. McGregor
  • Braddock K. Linsley
ArticleOpen Access07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Unforeseen plant phenotypic diversity in a dry and grazed world (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Unforeseen plant phenotypic diversity in a dry and grazed world

Analysis of 20 chemical and morphological plant traits at diverse sites across 6 continents shows that the transition from semi-arid to arid zones is associated with an unexpected 88% increase in trait diversity.

  • Nicolas Gross
  • Fernando T. Maestre
  • Yoann Le Bagousse-Pinguet
Article07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Neuronal substance P drives metastasis through an extracellular RNATLR7 axis (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Neuronal substance P drives metastasis through an extracellular RNATLR7 axis

Hyperactivation of sensory neurons regulates multiple aspects of metastatic progression in breast cancer.

Article07 Aug 2024

elements.title: Single-crystalline metal-oxide dielectrics for top-gate 2D transistors (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Single-crystalline metal-oxide dielectrics for top-gate 2D transistors

By using intercalative oxidation techniques, stable, stoichiometric and atomically thin single-crystalline Al2O3 films can be produced, which can be effectively used as a dielectric in top-gated field-effect transistors based on two-dimensional materials.

  • Daobing Zeng
  • Ziyang Zhang
  • Zengfeng Di
ArticleOpen Access07 Aug 2024
